page.title: 13Epping Forest:Yardley Hill
page.content: Yardley Hill(3895) has a capping of{ {chalky boulder clay},a relict of the Ice Age, which confers a varied flora to the hilltop and its south facing slope.The field at the eastern end of the hill (Roddick's Field) boasts more than 30 species of flowering plant and a fine butterfly population inc.{ {Common Blue,Small Heath,Meadow {Brown,Large/Small and Essex Skippers.} The south facing slope of the hill is managed hawthorn and rose scrubland with occaisional oak and ash standards; an attractive habitat for summer visiting warblers inc.{ {Chiff-Chaff,Willow-Warbler,Garden {Warbler,Blackcap,Whitethroat & Lesser {Whitethroat.}It is also the haunt of{ {Yellowhammer,Linnet and a number of {Titmice,}and in the hunting range of a {Kestrel.}
